history.content:
It is being offered and is in the process of being scheduled. It will appear in the campus schedule by mid-April if not earlier.

Grad courses never count towards the 20 UD unit requirement, unless a petition is submitted. In order to be approved, we must verify that the course is as rigorous as an upper division (non-special topics) course.

I'll let Michael-David answer the question about whether it's being offered or not. 

Grad courses never count towards the 20 UD unit requirement, unless a petition is submitted. In order to be approved, we must verify that the course is as rigorous as an upper division (non-special topics) course.

1. CS294-84: Interactive Device Design appears in the next CS course schedule for Fall 2016, but when I search the new scheduling system, it doesn't appear (see pic). Is this still being offered?
  2. Also, does this count for the 20 units of upper div credits for EECS?
history.subject: CS294-84 Interactive Device Design not in schedule search
